page.title: 17WEST OF DRAYCOTT VILLAGE
page.content: Fields either side of the railway showed rough pasture and some cereals growing.One large field of barley was more recently six smaller fields. Hedgerows present as boundaries,and alive with birdlife are now fewer in number.At Bankfield farm medium sized herd of Friesian cattle are kept for dairy farming. The only other produce being the fruit from 60 pear trees in an orchard attached to Melbourne House.Grass for cattle feed grew around pylons taking power cables in all directions.The footpath at the end of Nooning Lane seemed little used, was overgrown,and petered out near Bankfield farm.The busy railway line taking trains to,Derby, Nottingham, London and the North cuts through the square but the nearest station is 4 miles away.
